str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Or sugchuno from sun and cheo or its alternate; to commingle promiscuously, i.e. to throw into disorder, to perplex.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.
